Package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc

Class RxBitcoinClient

java.lang.Object
org.consensusj.jsonrpc.AbstractRpcClient
org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcClientHttpUrlConnection
org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient
org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinExtendedClient
org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc.RxBitcoinClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, ChainTipClient, ChainTipService, RxJsonChainTipClient, AsyncSupport, JacksonRpcClient, JsonRpcClient, RxJsonRpcClient
public class RxBitcoinClient extends BitcoinExtendedClient implements RxJsonChainTipClient
A BitcoinClient enhanced with Reactive features. Can use either ZeroMQ or polling to implement RxJsonChainTipClient.

TODO: answer the below questions

Should this class eventually implement RxBlockchainService or RxBlockchainBinaryService?

Should this class be renamed to RxBitcoinJsonRpcClient and the RxBitcoinClient interface be moved to cj-btc-rx?

    • activeChainTipFromBestBlock

      public io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single<ChainTip> activeChainTipFromBestBlock(org.bitcoinj.core.Block block)
      Convert best Block to active ChainTip. If BIP34 is activated this is purely computational, otherwise I/O is required to fetch the ChainTip
      Parameters:
      block - Input best block
      Returns:
      active ChainTip assuming this block is the "best block"

    • getBestBlockViaRpc

      public io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single<org.bitcoinj.core.Block> getBestBlockViaRpc()
      Get the latest (aka "best") Block via JSON-RPC.

      Generally, you should use the RxBlockchainService or RxBlockchainBinaryService interface if you are looking for a reactive interface to blocks, because those interfaces will be more efficient. This method always composes two unique RPC calls to the server.

      Returns:
      A "hot" Single that will fetch the "best" block via JSON-RPC
